column4: hey guys, I'm getting LBA and CHS mismatch errors after I partition my dual boot setup and when I rewrite the MBR using testdisk it skips my grub bootloader and boots right to windows...
any ideas or anyone come across this problem before?
daklan... newcomer to bittorrent huh?
what do you consider  "features"?
torrents are slow?  compared to what kelvin?
well if you can find everything on rapidshare at 1250kbps then i'd go for it then
ok, so having problems getting a dualboot online after partitioning... anyone have any dualboot experience in here?
did you install xp second
what is the exact prob then
how do i kill a process?  transmissions window went grey and wont quit
package for redhat fedora suse and the like; debian ubuntu use .deb packages
ignore him please
i can do that
they are the same under the hood. try 10.10
what about lubuntu?
low end, sure (less ram slower cpu)
the lubuntu installer has failed on a few different attempts
there's a lubuntu iso?
yeah, but it's not officially canonical
then install whichever, and run either !puregnome or !purekde !pure xfce and install lubuntu-desktop
ah, ok good point
